info.title: Cado Platform API
info.description:
The documentation reference for the Cado platform's RESTful API. The API can integrate with every part of the platform, from user management, querying timeline data, and importing evidence from the cloud. We provide some example Python scripts to help you get started.

Using the API requires an API key, which can be obtained from the Cado platform. This API key needs to be used with the `Authorization` header in the Bearer format. For example: Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY.

Each API will have a few extra parameters listed in the description, these parameters describe how the API behaves and what it expects. The parameters we list are:
  • Feature Lifecycle: This indicates if the API is in beta or production. If the API is in beta, you may need to enable it in the Experiments settings inside the platform. APIs with a beta flag are considered unstable and are subject to change or removal at any point, and are not recommended for production use.
  • Admin Only: This indicates if the API requires an administrator user account.

keyvault_uri.description: The Key Vault name to be used as the Secrets Manager - Azure only

default.description: A response indicating an error has occurred.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "error".

message.description: The error message returned by the API. In some cases, the message will contain a link to documentation for further troubleshooting.

code.description: An error code that can be given to Cado support for further troubleshooting.

data.description: Any supporting data returned by the API that can help with further troubleshooting.

200.description: A response indicating that Secrets Manager was successfully updated.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "success".

data.description: Any supporting data returned by the API that can help with further troubleshooting.

message.description: A description of the state of the Secrets Manager.

get.summary: Browse a list of S3 buckets
get.description: Browse a list of S3 buckets inside a specific AWS account.

parameters.name: cloud_id
parameters.description: The alias of the chosen AWS account to browse. See the Clouds API documentation for more info on obtaining the cloud_id for a specific AWS account.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pointer to the next page given by the response of the previous/current page.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The amount of items to be given per page. If left blank, the default will be 10.

name.description: The name of the S3 bucket.

creation_date.description: The date and time the S3 bucket was created.

type.description: A string indicating the type of pagination supported by the API. In this context, the value will be "cursor".

current_token.description: A string representing the pointer to this current page.

per_page.description: The amount of items to be given per page.

next_token.description: A string representing a cursor to the next page. Use this in place of the `cursor` attribute to get the next page.

previous_token.description: A string representing a cursor to the previous page. Use this in place of the `cursor` attribute to get the previous page.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "success".

code.description: An error code that can be given to Cado support for further troubleshooting.

data.description: Any supporting data returned by the API that can help with further troubleshooting.

message.description: The error message returned by the API. In some cases, the message will contain a link to documentation for further troubleshooting.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "error".

default.description: A response indicating an error has occurred.

get.summary: Browse a list of S3 bucket objects
get.description: Browse a list of S3 bucket objects inside a specific AWS account.

parameters.name: cloud_id
parameters.description: The alias of the chosen AWS account to browse. See the Clouds API documentation for more info on obtaining the cloud_id for a specific AWS account.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pointer to the next page given by the response of the previous/current page.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The maximum amount of results to be given per query. The query returns anywhere between MAX/2 and MAX results due to how the S3 API operates. If left blank, the default will be 10.

parameters.name: bucket_name
parameters.description: The bucket to get contents from

parameters.name: delimiter
parameters.description: The delimeter used to separate paths in the file name. Defaults to "/"

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: The prefix to filter the objects by. Must end in a "/"

name.description: The filename of the S3 object

last_modified.description: The timestamp of the last modification of the S3 object

size.description: The size of the S3 object in bytes

storage_class.description: The storage class of the S3 object

oneOf.description: An object representing a folder in S3

name.description: The name of the folder

type.description: A string indicating the type of pagination supported by the API. In this context, the value will be "cursor".

current_token.description: A string representing the pointer to this current page.

per_page.description: The amount of items to be given per page.

next_token.description: A string representing a cursor to the next page. Use this in place of the `cursor` attribute to get the next page.

previous_token.description: A string representing a cursor to the previous page. Use this in place of the `cursor` attribute to get the previous page.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "success".

code.description: An error code that can be given to Cado support for further troubleshooting.

data.description: Any supporting data returned by the API that can help with further troubleshooting.

message.description: The error message returned by the API. In some cases, the message will contain a link to documentation for further troubleshooting.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "error".

default.description: A response indicating an error has occurred.

get.summary: Get a list of scripts that can be executed on SSM enabled devices.
get.description: Retrieve a list of scripts that can be executed on SSM enabled devices, either get all or can search based on name and operating system.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the script to search for.

parameters.name: operating_system
parameters.description: The operating system of the device that the script will be run on.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to get notifications for

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of notifications to get per page

items.description: A script that can be executed on SSM enabled devices.

id.description: The resource ID for the script.

name.description: The name of the script.

os.description: The operating system of the device that the script will be run on.

script_input_uri.description: The value of the script IO input. This should be a S3 URI of where to download from. Should be identified in the script using ${INPUT}.

script_output_uri.description: The value of the script IO output. This should be a path in the S3 Cado default bucket. Should be identified in the script using ${OUTPUT}.

created_datetime.description: The timestamp of when the script was created.

updated_datetime.description: The timestamp of when the script was last updated.

type.description: A string indicating the type of pagination supported by the API. In this context, the value will be "page".

total_records.description: An integer representing the total amount of data we're paging.

current_page.description: An integer representing the current page of data (we use this to work out next and previous pages). NOTE: this is 1-indexed (i.e. it starts at 1).

total_pages.description: An integer representing the total number of pages.

per_page.description: An integer representing the number of records per page.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "success".

200.description: A reponse indicating that scripts have been successfully retrieved.

code.description: An error code that can be given to Cado support for further troubleshooting.

data.description: Any supporting data returned by the API that can help with further troubleshooting.

message.description: The error message returned by the API. In some cases, the message will contain a link to documentation for further troubleshooting.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "error".

default.description: A response indicating an error has occurred.

post.summary: Create a new script to be executed on SSM enabled devices.
post.description: Create a new script which will be run on SSM enabled devices. A script can have "input" or "output" variables associated with it which will specify where to copy from, or copy files to respectively. Returns the resource ID of the created script.

name.description: The name of script being created.

description.description: A brief description of the script being created.

os.description: The operating system of the device that the script will be run on. This can have a value of "linux" or "windows".

script.description: The contents of the script being created.

script_input_uri.description: The value of the script IO input. This should be a S3 URI of where to download from. Should be identified in the script using ${INPUT}.

script_output_uri.description: The value of the script IO output. This should be a path in the S3 Cado default bucket. Should be identified in the script using ${OUTPUT}.

200.description: The resource ID of the script created.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "success".

data.description: The data returned containing the resource ID of the script created.

script_id.description: The resource ID of the script created.

code.description: An error code that can be given to Cado support for further troubleshooting.

data.description: Any supporting data returned by the API that can help with further troubleshooting.

message.description: The error message returned by the API. In some cases, the message will contain a link to documentation for further troubleshooting.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "error".

default.description: A response indicating an error has occurred.

patch.description: Update an existing script which will be run on SSM-enabled devices. A script can have "input" or "output" variables associated with it which will specify where to copy from, or copy files to respectively. Returns details of the updated script.

parameters.name: script_id
parameters.description: ID of the script you want to update.

name.description: The name of script.

description.description: A brief description of the script.

script_input_uri.description: The value of the script IO input. This should be a S3 URI of where to download from. Should be identified in the script using ${INPUT}.

script_output_uri.description: The value of the script IO output. This should be a path in the S3 Cado default bucket. Should be identified in the script using ${OUTPUT}.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "success".

data.description: The data being returned containing details of the updated script.

id.description: The ID of the updated script.

name.description: The name of the updated script.

description.description: A brief description of the updated script.

os.description: The operating system of the device that the updated script will be run on. This can have a value of "linux" or "windows".

script.description: The contents of the updated script.

script_input_uri.description: The value of the script IO input. This should be a S3 URI of where to download from. Should be identified in the script using ${INPUT}.

script_output_uri.description: The value of the script IO output. This should be a path in the S3 Cado default bucket. Should be identified in the script using ${OUTPUT}.
